In-Person Address     NYU Office of University Programs  Academic Resource Center (ARC)  18 Washington Place, Ground Floor  New York, NY 10003   Student Walk-In Hours: Mondays 10 a.m. - 12 noon, Wednesdays 4:30 p.m. - 6:30 p.m., Thursdays 1 p.m. - 3 p.m.     To meet with a representative from the Office of University Programs outside of walk-in hours, please contact the Academic Resource Center at 212-998-2272 to schedule an appointment.                             Questions about particular courses or credits?                   Contact the appropriate academic department directly for information. For academic questions such as course selection and registration, adding or dropping a course, and tutoring or academic support, contact the Academic Resource Center.            Read More                                        Current NYU Student Inquiries and Registration     All current, degree-seeking NYU students should contact their academic adviser or department directly for information about taking summer or January courses, or participating in study abroad programs.              Transfer Student Information   Visiting Students programs are only for students who are interested in attending NYU for one semester. If you are interested in transferring to NYU, please contact NYU's Office of Undergraduate Admissions at 212-998-4500 or visit the Transfer Applicants section of their website.              Previously Enrolled NYU Students     If you were previously enrolled as a degree-seeking student at NYU, please visit the Readmission Applicants page for more information. The contact information provided below is for some of the University's more critical offices.         If you are looking for a specific person or specific information at New York University, you can search for them in our online directories, or call the number listed to the right.     Student Information   University Development and Alumni Relations   University Relations and Public Affairs                      Student Information   The offices below cover a wide range of needs for prospective, incoming, and current students. If you're looking for information regarding taking a tour of NYU, financial aid, registration for classes, and paying your bill, the offices below can guide you.        Undergraduate Admissions   For information sessions and campus tours:   Jeffrey S. Gould Welcome Center  50 West Fourth Street  New York, NY 10003  212.998.4550  Weekdays: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM  Saturday: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM   For questions about admissions and to mail application materials:   665 Broadway, 11th Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4500   admissions.ops@nyu.edu          Office of Financial Aid   25 West Fourth Street, 1st Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4444  212.995.4661 (Fax)   financial.aid@nyu.edu   Office of the Registrar   25 West Fourth Street, 1st Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4800 (University Registrar General Number)     Office of the Bursar   25 West Fourth Street, 1st Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.2800          The Student Resource Center   60 Washington Square South, Suite 210  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4411  Contact via email: Ask Us a Question        Student Health Center   726 Broadway, 3rd and 4th Floors  New York, NY 10003  212.443.1000   health.center@nyu.edu            University Development and Alumni Relations   NYU’s office of University Development and Alumni Relations (UDAR) focuses on the engagement of the entire NYU community – trustees, deans, students, faculty members, administration and staff, alumni, parents, and friends. If you have questions regarding alumni benefits or giving to the University, please contact UDAR and they can guide you.   UDAR Office   25 West Fourth Street, 4th Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.6900            University Relations and Public Affairs   University Relations and Public Affairs is responsible for ensuring that NYU’s message, agenda, and image are effectively and creatively projected to both external and internal audiences. If you have questions regarding NYU and its local community, photo or film shoots, or using the University's brand or identity, contact the offices below and someone will guide you in the right direction.   Office of Public Affairs   25 West Fourth Street, 5th Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.6840   Office of Government and Community Affairs   25 West Fourth Street, 5th Floor  New York, NY 10012  212.998.2400                                          New York University        70 Washington Square South          New York, NY 10012                      212.998.1212              Department of Public Safety   14 Washington Place, 1st Floor  New York, NY 10003  212.998.2222        NYU Parent's Helpline   212.998.4219  Contact via email: Ask Us a Question        Office of Residential Life and Housing Services   726 Broadway, 7th Floor  New York, NY 10003  212.998.4600   housing@nyu.edu        Bobst Library Information   70 Washington Square South  New York, NY 10012  212.998.2500   Coles Sports Center   181 Mercer Street  New York, NY 10012  212.998.2020   Palladium Athletic Facility   140 East 14th Street  New York, NY 10003  212.992.8500   Skirball Center for the Performing Arts,  Shagan Box Office   566 La Guardia Place  New York, NY 10012  212.992.8484   Main Bookstore   726 Broadway  New York, NY 10003  212.998.4667   NYU Computer Store   726 Broadway (inside Main Bookstore)  New York, NY 10003  212.998.4672   Copy Central   547 La Guardia Place  New York, NY 10012  212.998.1050   Mail Services   547 La Guardia Place  New York, NY 10012  212.998.1010   Student Affairs   60 Washington Square South, Suite 601  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4410   Student Activities   60 Washington Square South, Suite 704C  New York, NY 10012  212.998.4700                                              NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. Here you'll find the most up-to-date and relevant NYU news and information for counselors. Feel free to peruse and learn more about what's happening at the University. As always, if you have any questions about NYU, the admissions process, or your admissions candidates, please contact us .            Record-Breaking 60,000 Students Applied to NYU   We were humbled this winter after learning that a record-breaking 60,000 students applied to NYU—the largest increase in 15 years. Interest in NYU's new campuses in Abu Dhabi and Shanghai was especially significant, with a 26% rise in applicants to NYU Abu Dhabi and a 31% increase in applications to NYU Shanghai. The University's campus in New York experienced a 14% increase. More than 20 percent of applicants to NYU applied to more than one campus.                                                           New Majors at NYU   NYU now offers a major in Public Policy , offered jointly by the Wagner School of Public Service and the College of Arts and Science. The Tisch School of the Arts also announced 2 new programs:     Game Design : Game Design is an interdisciplinary major including courses in game studies, game design and game development, as well as the option to specialize in game programming, visual or audio design, and the business of games.   Performance Studies : Performance Studies builds on an interdisciplinary core curriculum combining analytical and practical research to train students to identify and write about behaviors and events, and to understand how social structures and relations are made.               Summer Programs at NYU   We continue to improve our summer offerings for high school students at NYU. NYU Precollege remains our signature summer program, but did you know about our 1-week Summer Academy at our School of Professional Studies, or our 1-week, no-charge, College Access Leadership Institute (NYU CALI) for students in under-represented communities?   You can learn more about our array of high school programs by visiting nyu.edu/high-school-programs .                                                             New Virtual Tour Video   If you or your students have yet to visit our New York City campus, let us come to you! Our new virtual tour video gives you an up-close look at our beautiful New York campus in the heart of Manhattan's Greenwich Village and downtown Brooklyn's Tech Triangle, with NYU Admissions Ambassadors serving as your tour guides. Click here to view the tour!        NYU Sends Most Students Abroad   The Institute for International Education recently reported that after 12 years, NYU surpassed the University of Southern California as the leading host for international students, as well as leading the U.S. in sending more of its own students abroad—the first time a university has held both titles since Boston University did the same in 1996.   Nearly 20% of our freshmen are citizens of 92 countries outside the United States, our largest ever international community.                                                                    NYU in Your City »        Join us for a Counselor Event                                             Meet the Admissions Team                                               Academic Programs                                               Schools & Colleges                                               NYU Facts                                               Learn More about Scholarship Opportunities at NYU                                                       Submitting Documents   If possible, please submit school documents and forms such as School Reports, transcripts, school profiles, and recommendation letters by using the Common Application's online School Forms Support Center.   If you do not have access to the online School Forms system, you may send documents to us via postal mail or fax with a school letterhead or cover sheet to:   NYU Office of Undergraduate Admissions  665 Broadway, 11th Floor  New York, NY USA 10012  Fax: +1 212 995 4911                                              NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. The Tisch School of the Arts also announced 2 new programs:     Game Design : Game Design is an interdisciplinary major including courses in game studies, game design and game development, as well as the option to specialize in game programming, visual or audio design, and the business of games.   Performance Studies : Performance Studies builds on an interdisciplinary core curriculum combining analytical and practical research to train students to identify and write about behaviors and events, and to understand how social structures and relations are made.               Summer Programs at NYU   We continue to improve our summer offerings for high school students at NYU. NYU Precollege remains our signature summer program, but did you know about our 1-week Summer Academy at our School of Professional Studies, or our 1-week, no-charge, College Access Leadership Institute (NYU CALI) for students in under-represented communities?   You can learn more about our array of high school programs by visiting nyu.edu/high-school-programs .                                                             New Virtual Tour Video   If you or your students have yet to visit our New York City campus, let us come to you! Our new virtual tour video gives you an up-close look at our beautiful New York campus in the heart of Manhattan's Greenwich Village and downtown Brooklyn's Tech Triangle, with NYU Admissions Ambassadors serving as your tour guides. Click here to view the tour!        NYU Sends Most Students Abroad   The Institute for International Education recently reported that after 12 years, NYU surpassed the University of Southern California as the leading host for international students, as well as leading the U.S. in sending more of its own students abroad—the first time a university has held both titles since Boston University did the same in 1996.   Nearly 20% of our freshmen are citizens of 92 countries outside the United States, our largest ever international community.
